intro: Grammitis queenslandica, commonly known as the Queensland hound's-tongue, is a fern native to Australia. It belongs to the family Hymenophyllaceae and is characterized by its delicate, finely divided fronds. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as rainforests and along stream banks. Its small, kidney-shaped spore cases are borne on the underside of its leaves. Grammitis queenslandica is often found on rocks or decaying wood, contributing to the biodiversity of its ecosystem.
